channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree support broken, 9th June
item.description:
At the end of last week a car (not seen before) parked outside 77 facing Poverest Road. A neighbour saw it later doing a three point turn to depart towards Elysian Road and in doing so it uprooted one of the tree supports
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Sutherland Avenue, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large, deep pothole causing damage to cars and houses, 9th June
item.description:
This pothole has been here for four months. It has damaged my car and causes houses to shake as vehicles hit it. It is just ahead of the Tivoli Road bus stop on the opposite side of the road to the doctors surgery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Dale, Upper Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building materials left in public walk way, 9th June
item.description:
Building materials have been left piled high very dangerously and obstructing the public walk way. This causes risks to the public which could cause an injury should they fall. Access restrictions for vulnerable people; wheelchair users and young/small children. Should this fall this could cause injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shinglewell Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large budleia overhanging turning area, 9th June
item.description:
At the end of lower station road to heathlee road the turning area has a large wild Budleia bush overhanging the road you cannot see the kerb and its so overgrown you can't see all the road words under it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Station Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road to Crayford station encroaching vegetation, 9th June
item.description:
The road to Crayford Station from station road has vegetation encroaching on the already narrow section of road. This regularly needs cutting back to the brick wall underneath the vegetation. This avoids cars mounting the pavement as they can't pass each other and would protect pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Lower Station Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation feom railway covering half the path, 9th June
item.description:
The path from crayford station to station road junction has more than half the path covered by vegetation from the railway, people pass each other in the road now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Lower Station Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
